title: Africa: the land and its people. No. 5
brief_description: Magazine items: The malarial mosquito, the common house fly and the codlin moth are three of the insect pests of the Union. Pyrethrum flowers, grown in Kenya, are processed into insecticides effective is the destruction of all such pests. Second part of the film shows the art of Erma Stern, in particular the artist’s skill in capturing on canvas the many types of people of diversified origin who compose South Africa’s population.
